flawed_nl_solution:
James earns 20*0.2=$<<20*0.2=4>>4 less while working his second job
So he earns 20-4=$<<20-4=16>>16 an hour
At his first job he earns 20*30=$<<20*30=600>>600
He works 30/2=<<30/2=51>>51 hours at his second job
So he earns 51*16=$<<51*16=816>>816
So he earns 600+816=$<<600+816=1416>>1416 a week

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 15.0, not 51.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
